title: Azir's a little strong guys.
body: Just pointing that out there. Don't post the winrate on him, I really don't care. He's doing a lot of damage.

replies.body: I've commented on it before but there is a couple reasons why he is currently pretty beefy and why Riot isn't touching him. Not going to go off again but simply put, wait until Runes because that will effect him A LOT. He is likely a tad overtuned for that vary reason and nerfing him now would be a waste of time and resources. He is also in a weird spot where he suddenly jumped like 5% playrate so people are all of a sudden needing to relearn the matchup along with his new weaknesses. Give it some time for players to readjust to him.

We actually are shipping some Azir nerfs on 7.21, but your general point remains. It's nigh on impossible to tell what the lay of the land is going to look like as we move into Runes Reforged, so trying to make him 100% correct right now would likely be a waste of time.

Yeah that's what I figured :P

Thanks for the reply XD
That's when you punish by jumping on him cause he can't reposition his soldiers for quite some time
That's what his r is for...

To be fair, that R has a fairly high cooldown. A Jax, an Akali- anything that can re-engage quickly also feels strong against him. 

Also, his player base tends to be fairly experienced with him, and in experienced hands, any champion feels strong. Don't get down on yourself. There are always chances to come up with new ways to tackle recurring problems.

When a champion like azir is doing a lot of damage chances are even with your gap closer you're likely to die before you get to him. He can also just you know summon a soldier on top of himself. Idk how strong azir is atm to agree with OP i'm just saying though relying on an all out attack leaves too many options to counter that idea.
Yeah then Azir either dashes to his soldiers or just presses R on you....

Pssh. On you.

A good Azir shuffles you AND your jungler under his tower for a double. :P

I played a game of him in twisted treeline today and this is completely anecdotal, but the cooldown on his soldiers (arise!) is actually really low. In fact looking at the wiki it's about the same as his Q.
And I'm pretty certain one of the changes they made to him is summon lots of soldiers gives you a very big attackspeed bonus. So it's not actually too far fetch'd as azir to just summon soldiers at point blank instead of relying on Q to re-position

But I think what's really making him shine and pushing him up there is his E always gives a shield regardless of context which makes him much more safer since you can use it defensively to run away the same way riven does.
You can have 4 Soldiers up if you just get a little bit of CDR, it's complete bonkers.

What do you mean by reposition his soliders for quite some time?

Azir maxes Q first, and that puts it on a 5 second CD at level 9. Thats pretty fucking low.

I mean, he really isn't all that bad....

....until you realize his Q is undodgeable...
Is it a click and point now?

No but the hitbox of the Q got buffed a LOT, and at the speed that his soldiers jump on you, you require lightning reflexes if you want to stand a chance at dodging them...

I was standing behind my tower and Azir could just easily poke me and chunk me from outside turret range...

It's the "thrust" the soldiers do at the end of their Q with their spears.

They did it to compensate for his overal Q range nerf
Why compensate losing range...with more range?

Elementary, my dear Mystic.

Because before, I could Q to you and keep hitting you with autos.

Now, I can only Q and hit you with the thrust, but my soldier can't attack you anymore.

Not quite undodgeable, but nearly.

Which basically means that Azir gets a guaranteed Thunderlords proc whenever he wants.

Side note, does the new Runes Reforged Thunderlords work with his Soliders AA?

The question is: Will you still go for thunderlords or are there better options?

I'll be doing some testing on the PBE. (You can do that as well if you are lvl 30 and honor 3+ now btw)

I am actually doing that rn.

I am currently testing Press the Attack.

But I think the Sorcery tree is overall better becuase he needs the AP imo.
You don't get instant thunderlords proc if you attack with 2+ soldiers. AA+Q+AA still works though.

His laning phase is too strong, old Azir was at his lowest point mid game and now new Azir is a beast at that time. Then since he's a DPS mage, his lategame is just stupid. The range nerfs weren't enough to balance the amount of damage he does. The rework didn't solve anything, it just made his damage higher, he gets free attack speed, and now he gets an AP scaling shield for just pressing E. It's impossible to lose trades as him unless you're against someone named Kassadin. It's impossible to get outscaled unless you're against twitch. That's it. Two champions in the entire game "counter" him. Since he has so much more access to soldiers he's even safer than he was before as well. Having 1-2 soldiers was a tradeoff between doing more damage or being safe and was easier to avoid. Just balance him around that...

He has something to answer anything in the game. He has no shortage of mobility, damage, range, safety. Haven't even mentioned his ability to knock enemies out of position for a guaranteed gank. And don't say that takes crazy mechanics, because it really doesn't. Wanna win a teamfight? Press W 3 times and Q in their general direction.

the only counterplay to 3 soldiers up is just "be ranged" or be on the other side of the map

He also rushes Morello now (since you don't even need Nashor's anymore to do damage since W gives you that FAT attack speed steroid) so he doesn't even run out of mana and can W+Q you on cooldown after level like 5 and never run out of mana because Lost Chapter is a very well thought out item still.
You say he rushes Morello now, but according to OP.gg, in plat+ Azir isnt even building Morello at all. Everyone is still building nashor's first.

Morello's still better on him. Or RoA if you're struggling in lane.

It's not a must have item but rushing Nashor's is a sure way to start late into the damage game.

Thank you. A LOT of Azir's damage is in his scalings currently and dumping 3k on an item that doesn't add THAT much damage (nor utility) especially on it's GARBAGE build path isn't a way to start the game. You don't NEED the Attack Speed until later on in the game and even then you are usually better off with more AP/Pen that way your shuffle does A LOT more damage and you get a bigger shield. Also Lost Chapter COMPLETELY removing that blue bar under your health when combined with DRing means you can W+Q your lane opponent basically on cooldown and win almost every single trade since you also happen to get a fairly large shield....for doing nothing.
Sounds like Orianna a little if you ask me.

His laning phase has too much damage, it was specifically nerfed because he's oppressive when he has damage early since his poke pattern is so basic. 

I feel that he's worse late game now though, he can't safely DPS. He's all based around his shuffle late game now.

His changes seem somewhat contrary to the goals of his rework.

Only marginally decreased range and safety:
-Due to the Q hitbox ("thrust") change, his poke range is still comparable to his old.
-The new Q clumping mechanic greatly augments his late game poke/burst/DPS.
-Due to the W placement range increase, his panic shuffle's length is only ~100 range shorter.  He can also more safely place soldiers  directly in range of lane minions without having to spend 70 mana on a Q.
-Azir gains a shield on E even when using it purely defensively.

Battle mage?
-Azir's long range playmaking shuffles decrease a full ~150 range along with his Q, unlike his panic shuffles.
-Itemization is shifting from Nashor's + multiplicative stats to Morello's + flat penetration.

I'd say the aggregate of Azir's scaling shield, huge AS buff on W, and Q clumping mechanic more than offsets his situational loss of ~150 range.

However, I still think a large part of Azir's recent powerup has been due to the new builds that skip Nashor's and even go for flat penetration over Rylai's.  Imagine if Azir had been given love tap buffs that specifically allowed him to dip into the ubiquitous midlane Morello's+Sorc's build.  I wouldn't want this, but I think he'd probably be viable.  Instead we got very large buffs that _still_ pigeonholed him into that build.
You know who else is really strong with all these good ADC items lying around?  Tryndamere.
